solution_line_template: Mortdecai collects a total of {collects_per_day}x{num_collection_days} = <<{collects_per_day}*{num_collection_days}={total_collected_dozens}>>{total_collected_dozens} dozens of eggs.
He sells a total of {delivered_to_market} + {delivered_to_mall} = <<{delivered_to_market}+{delivered_to_mall}={total_sold_dozens}>>{total_sold_dozens} dozens of eggs.
So, {total_collected_dozens} - {total_sold_dozens} = <<{total_collected_dozens}-{total_sold_dozens}={remaining_dozens_after_sale}>>{remaining_dozens_after_sale} dozens of eggs are left.

After using {used_for_pie} dozens of eggs to make a pie, {remaining_dozens_after_sale} - {used_for_pie} = <<{remaining_dozens_after_sale}-{used_for_pie}={remaining_dozens_after_pie}>>{remaining_dozens_after_pie} dozens of eggs are left.

Since there are {eggs_per_dozen} in 1 dozen, then Mortdecai donates {remaining_dozens_after_pie} x {eggs_per_dozen} = <<{remaining_dozens_after_pie}*{eggs_per_dozen}={donated_eggs}>>{donated_eggs} pieces of eggs to the charity.
